Nearly all iPhones exported by Foxconn from India went to the United States between March and May, customs data showed . Numbers show Apple has realigned its India exports to almost exclusively serve the U.S. market . During March-May, Foxconn exported iPhones worth $3.2 billion from India .  U.S. President Donald Trump says China will face 55% tariffs . The two countries agreed on a plan, subject to both leaders' approval, to ease levies that had reached triple digits . Apple has been taking steps to speed up production from India to bypass tariffs .  Made-in-India iPhones expected to account for 25% to 30% of global iPhone shipments in 2025, analyst says . Apple chartered planes to transport iPhone 13, 14, 16 and 16 models worth roughly $2 billion to the U.S. in March . Apple has lobbied Indian airport authorities to cut the time needed to clear customs at Chennai airport .  Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi has in recent years promoted India as a smartphone manufacturing hub . High duties on importing mobile phone components means it is still expensive to produce in India . Apple has historically sold more than 60 million iPhones in the U.S. each year .

Apple(AAPL) disappointed both fans and investors at the Worldwide Developers Conference (WWDC) This year, the highly anticipated event resulted in AAPL stock falling hard as investors reacted negatively to a disappointing update regarding one of Apple's flagship products .  The past month has brought numerous complications for Apple, primarily from Capitol Hill . President Donald Trump has made it clear that he doesn’t want the company to build iPhones in India, despite CEO Tim Cook’s plans to invest $500 billion in manufacturing in the U.S. over the coming years .  A well-known AAPL stock bull, Ives noted that the event revealed “slow and steady improvements" but still described it as “overall a yawner” CEO Ross Gerber is known for his blunt takes on tech stocks . Gerber also expressed strong disdain for Apple’s strategy .  Gerber’s statement could point to bigger problems that lie ahead, with the potential to compromise AAPL stock's growth . Gerber: Apple's legacy centers around products designed with simplicity and user ease, two things that Jobs emphasized in his work leading the company .  If Apple is indeed falling far from the tree, as Gerber suggests, it could end up disappointing its customers even more . That said, other experts have a more positive outlook on Apple’s chances of a rebound than Ives and Gerber . Wall Street veteran Chris Versace recently laid out his team's outlook for Apple .  First appeared on the cover of this week's CNN.com/Heroes.com . First appeared in the U.S. first appeared on Sunday, October 1 .

TaiwanSemiconductorManufacturing (TSM) is the silent powerhouse behind the AI boom . The stock is within grasp of yet another historic high around the $225 mark . Given how sharply TSM has bounced back, the stock could become the ultimate Tech Tech stock .  As the world’s largest contract chipmaker, it produces the advanced processors that Nvidia, AMD, and Apple rely on to bring AI to life . This is currently a major tailwind for TSMC, driving a 41.6% year-over-year revenue surge .  The company is investing $165 billion in U.S. factories, with Arizona’s first fab already fully booked by heavyweights like Nvidia and Qualcomm . In Europe, a new $10 billion plant in Dresden, Germany, and a chip design center in Munich are positioning TSMC to capture the continent's growing AI market .  TSMC has an aggressive capital expenditure plan of $38–$42 billion for this year, up from $29.8 billion in 2024 . Over 70% of that spending is allocated to next-generation 3nm and 2nm chip production . Despite TSMC’s explosive growth, the stock remains attractively valued .  The AI boom is a multi-year tailwind, driving sustained top and bottom-line growth . With over 60% global foundry market share and ongoing global expansion, TSMC’s scale and strategic positioning make that valuation look like a bargain .  TSMC may be one of the shrewdest long-term bets available . Trading at a forward P/E of 26, the stock offers a rare opportunity to own a high-growth industry leader at a reasonable valuation .

DTTM Operations LLC has applied to use his name and the term T1 for telecom services . The requests cover mobile phones, cases, battery chargers and wireless telephone services . A spokesperson for the Trump Organization didn’t immediately respond to a request for comment .  The filings suggest plans could be in the works for a Trump-branded mobile phone or service to compete with Verizon Communications Inc., AT&T Inc. and T-Mobile US Inc. "It would mark a significant expansion for Trump’s private business, which has historically focused on real estate, hospitality, and branded merchandise," lawyer says .

Liquid Glass is named with the idea that each window on a phone is like a pane of glass, see-through and somewhat reflective . It gives the screen a sleeker look, though in its developer beta, Apple hasn’t quiteworked out the kinksof playing with opacity .  Apple is rumored to be developing a $3,500 smart glasses . The glasses would have cameras, microphones, and speakers like its competitors . Siri would be built-in, and could assist with taking phone calls, playing music, translation, and turn-by-turn directions .  Apple AR glasses are rumored to be coming with Liquid Glass . The glasses are transparent and will blend into your surroundings . Apple is expected to unveil the glasses in September at a later date .

Apple recently faced a legal challenge from VoIP-Pal.com Inc., which initiated an antitrust lawsuit involving Apple and other tech giants . The lawsuit, targeting their alleged suppression of lawful competition in standalone Wi-Fi Calling, comes amidst Apple's introduction of several updates across its product lines . Despite these developments, Apple's share price moved by a modest 2% last week .  Apple has delivered a total return of 134.39% over a five-year period . Over the last year, the stock underperformed the US market, which returned 11.7% .  Analysts might expect Apple to navigate current challenges and achieve growth targets . Such a target anticipates that planned U.S. facility expansions and new product launches, such as the iPhone 16e, will drive revenue and earnings growth . However, macroeconomic conditions and legal outcomes are potential uncertainties .  Simply Wall St. has no position in any stocks mentioned . Companies discussed in this article include Apple . NasdaqGS:AAPL.

Apple shares may benefit from short-term upside as deep discounting in China fuels stronger-than-expected iPhone and iPad sales . China’s 618 Festival promotions and national subsidies are said to have been key drivers, leading to “very strong” iPhone sell-through for three consecutive weeks . Trend suggests “up to $4B June revenue upside vs. MSe, all else equal”  Morgan Stanley projects iPhone shipments to hit 49 million, which is “7% above MSe of 46.0M units, and 8% above Consensus at 45.2M” For iPads, they now see 14.7 million shipments, 20% above consensus at 12.3M units .

Apple may risk falling behind in AI after muted showing at WWDC, according to analysts . Recent iPhone upgrade cycle appears subdued, suggesting limited upside from incremental AI features . Services segment faces fresh headwinds after losing an appeal in the Epic Games App Store case, which may pressure commission revenues .  Investors are likely to monitor whether Apple ramps AI spending to catch up or relies on its ecosystem to monetize future services . Apple's ability to pivot may be critical for sustaining growth and justifying its premium valuation .

Roku’s ROKU Devices segment remains a challenging part of the business, acting more as a strategic tool to grow its user base than as a source of profitability . Roku maintains that its priority is growing its streaming footprint, even at the cost of short-term Devices profits . Roku projects Devices revenues to decline around 10% year over year, with margins staying negative .  The updated Roku-made TVs feature better picture and sound quality, faster app launches and deeper bass . The new Pro Series introduces QLED and Mini-LED technology, along with an upgraded Voice Remote Pro and software features like Smart Picture and personalized Backdrops .  ROKU shares have gained 10.3% in the trailing three months, outperforming the Zacks Broadcast Radio and Television industry’s return of 22% . The Zacks Consensus Estimate for second-quarter 2025 loss is pegged at 15 cents per share, which has remained steady over the past 30 days . Apple continues to attract loyal users through tight ecosystem linkages and exclusive content .  The consensus mark for 2025 loss is pegged at 17 cents per share, which has remained steady over the past 30 days . The estimate indicates 80.9% year-over-year growth . Roku carries a Zacks Rank #3 (Hold) You can seethe complete list of today’s Zacks #1 Rank (Strong Buy) stocks .

In 1999, PC World declared the personal computer the most important invention of the last 100 years . To celebrate, we put together an article looking back at 100 defining moments in computing history .  Apple’s upcoming iPadOS 26 operating system pushes tablet far closer to the Mac . Jesus Diaz argues that the shift not only overcomplicates the iPad but also violates Raskin's decades-old principles about how to make computing easy and intuitive . In 1979, Apple's 31st employee started at the company as its publications manager .  Raskin oversaw the development of a short-lived machine that stuck closer to his vision, the Canon Cat . After leaving Apple, he continued exploring ways to make computing more approachable . He died in 2005 .  The most accurate account of the Mac’s history that I have seen in print is in Apple Confidential . I do not think that the famous visit to PARC had much influence at all on the design . What it did do was get rid of Jobs’ antipathy to interface-oriented design and allowed us to proceed without his earlier opposition to the Mac project .  Engineers from PARC made the Mac interface more PARClike (and, in my opinion, harder to use, but spiffier and probably more marketable). Today’s interfaces are far more pleasant and interactive, at least on the surface, than what they replaced . They are convoluted, complex, opaque, and remarkably prone to crashing at the least provocation .  It will take a company with guts and financial strength to stand behind the radical improvement we need . Consumers will be standing up and cheering to be out from under the yoke of today’s antihuman interfaces .  The iPhone and iPad were conceived entirely for touch input . Google's Chromebooks turned the web browser into a full-blown computing environment . Amazon gave us Alexa, an assistant you could summon by talking to a speaker .  Apple has rolled out interface updates for computers, phones, tablets, watches, TV boxes, and headsets . With iPadOS 26, Apple is applying that same paradigm to the iPad . Even if you're impressed by them, it sounds like the scaling problem Raskin saw in 1999, times six .  Back in 1999, I quoted Raskin's point about Jobs’s PARC visit warming him to the potential of the embryonic Mac project . But even that didn’t get into his harsh assessment of current interfaces . Chromebooks started out rejecting native apps as an idea before succumbing to temptation to support Android ones .  The question remains a good starting point for judging new products . Holding them to high standards, as Raskin did, is the best way to answer it .  Meta is betting big on a new superintelligence lab, luring talent with massive paychecks and bringing in Scale AI’s Alexandr Wang . Insiders warn that deep internal dysfunction could sabotage the effort . Hinge is teaming up with Esther Perel to rethink dating prompts . President Donald Trump’s tariff regime may not be having the desired effect of bringing manufacturing back to the US yet . At first-quarter conferences, executives touted their “Made in America” credentials at a record rate . Companies in the S&P 500 Index called out domestic production over 200 times, compared with a 25-year average of around 50 mentions per earnings season .  Despite the patriotic enthusiasm, there’s little evidence corporate America has broken ground on new domestic facilities . Many commitments weren’t new or were in line with previous spending patterns . Touting new projects in response to tariffs could appear reactive .  The threat of retaliation from the White House has some companies seeking advice on how to stay out of trouble . Trump has showered ire on firms who he sees flouting the “America First” mindset by taking production abroad .  Management commentary on where the business is heading is critical, especially as specific financial outlooks become less reliable . CEO Ynon Kreiz took time to detail the company’s plans to decrease its exposure to Chinese suppliers by shifting more production to India .  At least 50 major US companies have withdrawn or suspended their outlooks as economic conditions make forecasting too difficult . Snap-on Inc. CEO Nick Pinchuk used the earnings call to expound on domestic capabilities .  Deere & Co. was similarly patriotic during its latest earnings call . CEO John May: “We’re proud of our storied US history. We stand by and continue to embrace our American manufacturing heritage”

Foxconn shipped roughly 97% of its $3.2 billion in iPhone exports to the U.S. between March and May . May alone saw about $1 billion of India-made iPhones land stateside, the second-largest monthly tally after March's $1.3 billion . Apple CEO Tim Cook told investors that most iPhones sold in the June quarter would be built in India .  Apple's shift underscores how global supply chains are realigning around tariff arbitrage . Former President Trump has threatened 25% levies on iPhones not made in the U.S. and 55% duties on Chinese goods .

Apple saw double-digit growth in Japan, India and Middle Eastern markets . Apple still faces stiff competition from Huawei, vivo and other domestic brands that have ramped up marketing .  Revenue impact hinges on whether Apple can sustain momentum against local rivals and manage its premium pricing in the face of broader economic pressures . Apple is betting that software upgrades and services bundling can reinforce hardware appeal .

Aggressive price cuts helped lift Apple's sales in China .  Based on the one year price targets offered by 41 analysts, the average target price for Apple Inc is $231.02 . The average target implies a upside of +15.97% from the current price of $199.20 . Future performance may hinge on sustained demand in Apple's two largest markets .

Nearly halfway through 2025, it's clear the stock market has a different character than in the past two years . In 2023 and 2024, investors championed the rise of the "Magnificent Seven" tech stocks . This year, things are looking more normal relative to market history .  Exhibit A co-founder Matt Cerminaronotes that as of June 11, the Magnificent Seven index, which includes Apple (AAPL), Alphabet (GOOGL,GOOG), Microsoft (MSFT), Amazon (AMZN), and Tesla (TSLA) has fallen 2.51% in 2025 . By comparison, the other 493 stocks in the S&P 500 have risen 5.32% .  AI and defense darling Palantir (PLTR) is the year's biggest winner in the index, rising 80% . The balance of the top 10 best-performing stocks flaunts a more diverse group .  Yahoo Finance. Yahoo Finance . Yahoo Finance will feature iReporter photos in a weekly Travel Snapshots gallery . Seven magnificent stocks account for more than $203 billion of Berkshire Hathaway's $283 billion investment portfolio . Buffett and his late right-hand man Charlie Munger have long believed in putting most of Berkshire's capital to work in their top ideas .  Warren Buffett is wagering 72% of Berkshire Hathaway's $283 billion of invested assets on just seven unstoppable stocks . Despite paring down 67% of Buffett's stake inApple, it still represents the Oracle of Omaha's largest holding by as much as $203.3 billion .  Apple has spent more than $750 billion to reduce its outstanding share count by 43.3% since kicking off its buyback initiative in 2013 . American Express is one of eight holdings Berkshire Hathaway has no intention of ever selling .  American Express is well positioned to navigate short-lived recessions . It's also Berkshire Hathaway's longest-tenured holding (since 1988) Coca-Cola's long-term outperformance is a reflection of its relatively unrivaled geographic diversity .  Coca-Cola has raised its base annual dividend for 63 consecutive years and is currently paying $0.51/quarter, or $2.04 annually . Since July 17, 2024, Buffett has overseen the sale of more than 401 million shares ofBank of America .  Bank of America's ability to prudently expand its loan portfolio during long-winded expansions has made it a clear winner . No large bank saw its interest income climb faster than BofA when the Fed was increasing interest rates at the fastest pace in four decades .  A higher spot price for oil can supercharge Chevron's drilling segment, which generates its juiciest margins . A lack of capital investment by global energy majors for a three-year period during the COVID-19 pandemic, coupled with Russia's invasion of Ukraine, creates a situation where crude oil supply may remain constrained for years .  Moody's Analytics provides intelligence and analytical tools to help businesses navigate changing regulatory environments and assess risk . The Oracle of Omaha has purchased almost 265 million shares ofOccidental Petroleum .  Occidental common stock since the beginning of 2022, which is worth about $11.5 billion, as of the closing bell on June 9, 2025 . Occidental has far less financial flexibility than energy majors like Chevron . Warren Buffett is an odd pick for Warren Buffett . Apple's iPhone sales grew 15% year-on-year during April and May in the tech giant's strongest performance for the two-month period since the COVID-19 pandemic . The increase in global sales was primarily driven by a return to growth in Apple's two largest markets, China and the United States .  Apple has faced increased competition from domestic rivals in China . Chinese e-commerce platforms were offering discounts of up to 2,530 yuan ($351) on Apple's latest iPhone 16 models .

Textron's revenue base is so large because nearly everyone in the U.S. has an iPhone .
